story.storykicker: If suddenly you feel your salary is a bit less and the world out there is anything but cheap then, it is not you it is the cess! Here's what you need to know about the new Krishi Kalyan Cess.
story.storybody:
The imposition of Krishi Kalyan Cess of 0.5 percent announced in this year's Budget will come into effect from today. Yes, today is the day when suddenly your salary will look all the more less and the world out of there will be anything but cheap. 

So now other than Swachh Bharat Cess, which was introduced last November, Krishi Kalyan Cess will also feature in your ex'cess' bill. 

Here's what you should know about it: 

1. 15 per cent service tax

The total service tax now goes up to 15 per cent! How? 14 per cent service tax plus 0.5 per cent Swacch Bharat Cess plus 0.5 per cent Krishi Kalyan Cess.

2. This cess will be applied on all taxable services

Want to fine dine? Pay cess.

Want to take a cab? Pay cess.

Basically, your weekend party and dinner dates will cost you more. 

3. Why was this introduced? 

Finance Minister Arun Jaitley wanted to ensure some tax money is spent for the poor farmers, so instead of restructuring the way already collected tax is being spent, he introduced this cess, 'proceeds of which would be exclusively used for financing initiatives relating to improvement of agriculture and welfare of farmers'. 

4. Proceeds go to Consolidated Fund of India

The proceeds of this cess will directly go under the control of the central government. This means that money collected from Krishi Kalyan Cess will not be deposited into a separate fund. 

5. Infrastructure Cess

If this cess could not bother you much then there is also another new cess that was introduced in this year's budget. Infrastructure Cess on vehicles which will range form 1%-4% depending on the size and kind of vehicle purchased.

Don't be surprised if the on-road price of the car you were planning to buy has increased.
